channel.title: Inventory problem
channel.description: I didnt change anything in my client on the granite mauls on my server but when I logged in my maul was like microscopic in my inventory. How do I fix this ??

item.title: Inventory problem
item.dc:creator: @dogzound5 dogzound5@gmail.com
item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

Ummm Well I am not sure about the client name but If I remember correctly it was CSK. The item id’s are different on my client then on server and I have changed them all accordingly. Still the gmaul does not show up with the ints at all but yesterday it was not like this. Do you have a link for a gmaul model that I could add as a custom to my server ??? I have searched this website but did not find any. All help is appreciated. Thank You

Read full topic

item.title: Inventory problem
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

God, what’s csk client. Allstar was made before csk im guessing since i don’t even know what csk is. (I’ve been gone for a while.) But im just guessing that csk uses different item id’s, or doesn’t have the items listed and corresponded with allstars item id’s. You’re going to have to manual make them compatible with each other.

item.title: Inventory problem
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Here is the ints for the Granite Maul.

if(i == 4153){ class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = [Ljava.lang.String;@f70f8e; class8.aString170 = Granite maul; class8.aByteArray178 = "Simplicity is the best weapon.".getBytes(); class8.anIntArray156 = new int[0]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[0]; class8.anInt174 = 5413;//Inv & Ground class8.anInt181 = 12000; class8.anInt190 = 308; class8.anInt198 = 36; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = 17; class8.anInt165 = 5410;//Male Wield View class8.anInt200 = 5410;//Female Wield View class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; }

Here is the item dump:

http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?bokmdday2mi

If it doesn’t work after you add the ints, your server is probably missing the Model image completely.

Read full topic

item.title: Inventory problem
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

You have to understand that when people make custom clients, they make them custom to their own item list. Not all id’s are the same, some aren’t even available. Using a server that’s isn’t compatible with the client you are using will result in invalid item ids and it’s not going to read.

I’m not saying you don’t know this already, but there are people who don’t.

Read full topic
